intro: Oncocalyx rhamnifolius, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a velvety texture, while its stems are hairy and robust. Oncocalyx rhamnifolius is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
